Pre-Game Insights: Cape Verde holds a slight historical advantage, having recorded one more win than Mauritania across their past encounters.
Cape Verde fell to a tough 3-0 defeat at the hands of Egypt in Cairo, leaving them in search of their first points of the campaign.
Mauritania claimed a well-earned victory in their first match, giving them a strong platform to build upon.
Cape Verde’s squad, led by Bubista, is determined to set the record straight after the loss to Egypt.
Cape Verde will likely look to control the tempo and play through their quick, attacking wingers, while Mauritania may adopt a more disciplined, counter-attacking approach.
